contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox musical artist <!-- See Wikipedia:WikiProject_Musicians --> | name = Tanzwut | image = Tanzwut German Band Live.jpeg | caption = Tanzwut performing live | image_size = 250 | landscape = yes | background = group_or_band | alias = | origin = [[Berlin]], Germany | genre = [[Neue Deutsche Härte]]<br />[[Industrial rock]]/[[Industrial metal|metal]]<br />[[Medieval metal]]/[[folk metal]] | years_active = Since 1998 | label = PICA Music Records, [[EMI Records|EMI]], Teufel Records | associated_acts = [[Corvus Corax (band)|Corvus Corax]] | website = [http://tanzwut.com/ Official website] | current_members = Mike "Teufel" Paulenz<br />Martin Ukrasvan<br />Der Zwilling<br />Shumon<br />Ardor<br />Thrymr<br / >Jackbird | past_members = Koll. A.<br />Brandan<br />Tec<br />Patrick<br />Jordon }} '''Tanzwut''' ({{IPA-de|ˈtantsvuːt}}) is a German [[Neue Deutsche Härte]] and [[medieval metal]] band which originated as a sideproject of [[Corvus Corax (band)|Corvus Corax]]-members. The band uses a [[medieval]] theme during their live performances which are expressed through their [[stagecraft]], costumes and [[choreography]]. <!-- ==History== --> == About == Their name is the German term for "[[dancing mania]]", but is directly translated with "dance-rage". Tanzwut are known for their heavy use of [[bagpipes]], an unusual instrument for a metal band. The group has achieved international success, filling concert halls as far away from their home country as [[Mexico]]. The band's recent releases have been gravitating towards a more [[industrial metal]] approach, incorporating the use of more down-tuned [[Electric guitar|guitars]], harsher vocals and darker atmospheres. On ''Weiße Nächte'' though, Tanzwut completely removed its industrial sound for a more refined classical approach centered around bagpipes with a heavy metal sound. == Discography == ===Studio albums=== * ''[[Tanzwut (album)|Tanzwut]]'' (''Dance-Rage'') (1999) * ''[[Labyrinth der Sinne]]'' (''Labyrinth of Senses'') (2000) * ''[[Ihr Wolltet Spass]]'' (''You Wanted Fun'') (2003) * ''[[Schattenreiter]]'' (''Shadow Rider'') (2006) * ''[[Weiße Nächte]]'' (''White Nights'') (2011) * ''Morus et Diabolus'' (2011) ===Live albums=== * ''Tanzwut - Live'' (DVD, 2004) ===Singles=== * "Augen Zu" ("Eyes Closed") (1999) * "Bitte, Bitte" ("Please Please") (1999) * "Weinst Du?" (Do you cry?)(1999) * "Verrückt" ("Insane") (1999) * "Tanzwut" (Dance Rage) (2000) * "Eiserne Hochzeit" ("Iron Wedding") (2001) * "Götterfunken" ("God-descended") (2001) * "Feuer und Licht" ("Fire and Light") (2001) * "Hymnus Cantica" (2003) * "Immer Noch Wach" ("Still Awake") (2005) === Promo === * "Exkremento" (album, 1998) * "Nein nein" ("No No") (single, 2003) == Band members == * Mike "Teufel" Paulenz – [[bagpipe]], lead [[singing|vocals]] * Der Zwilling – [[bass guitar]], bagpipe * Thrymr – bagpipe, [[shawm]] * Pyro – bagpipe, shawm * Shumon – [[percussion instrument|percussion]], [[electronic keyboard|keyboard]] * Oually – percussion, key drum, [[electronic drum]]s, riesentara, keyboard * Martin Ukrasvan – [[electric guitar|guitar]], [[backing vocalist|backing vocals]], bagpipe, [[tromba marina]] === Former members === * Koll. A. (a.k.a. Meister Selbstfried) – bagpipe, Shawm, [[cornett]] * Brandan – guitar, bagpipe * Tec – keyboard, programming * Wim - bass guitar, bagpipe * Patrick - electric guitar * Castus - bagpipe, shawm * Ardor - bagpipe, shawm * Gast - keyboard, drum machine * Norri - drums & percussion * Hatz - keyboard, electronic drums == External links== {{commons|Tanzwut|Tanzwut}} * [http://www.tanzwut.com Official website] {{de icon}} * {{MySpace|tanzwutmusic|Tanzwut}} * [http://www.gothtronic.com/?page=23&interviews=938 Interview with Patrick of Tanzwut] {{de icon}} [[Category:German heavy metal musical groups]] [[Category:Medieval metal musical groups]] [[Category:Industrial metal musical groups]] [[Category:German industrial music groups]] [[Category:Musical groups established in 1998]] [[Category:Musical groups from Berlin]] [[Category:EMI Records artists]] {{Germany-band-stub}}
